channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NM
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NM

item.title: Report X-2023070798
item.description:
Report X-2023070798

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-01T03:13:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was placed on a nearby tabletop, but upon finding the package moments later, it was then placed on the grate with an absorbency towel underneath it. Further inspection showed that both plastic caps on tin containers were loose. DescribePack: Both of leaking containers had a plastic strip across the lids, meant to hold the lids in place, but they were loosely attached. Lids were very loose, and no pressure was being applied from the plastic strips to hold in place. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and outter plastic bags were sealed.

item.title: Report E-2023070378
item.description:
Report E-2023070378

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-29
  • City: ALBUQUERQUE
  • State: NM
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Associate did not block and/or brace freight properly for transport. Freight was crushed causing release of product.
